intro: Cyrtandra decurrens var. wallichii, commonly known as the Wallich's cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species in horticulture.
